column4: i have a samba share on a ubuntu box that i can access with linux or windows, but not from osx... i know there is nothing wrong with the osx box because it can access a samba share on a gentoo box i have .... anyone seen anything like this?
everyone?
like all the official vendor supplied drivers in the kernel? ;)
like the nvidia drivers?
they are not in the kernel, they are distributed seperately
I mean things like e100 and aic7xxx, which are supplied by Intel and Adaptec respectively
or the philips webcam?
when did philips submit an official driver to kernel.org?
or the via raid stuff?
what via raid stuff?
exactly
you are misunderstanding what I am saying
my point was that when vendors submit drivers to the kernel they are not dismissed by anyone
so long as they are open source they aren't
in the top level of the kernel source check for a .config file and move it out of the way
i can do that... but i downloaded the source from kernel.org, but it still managed to find all this crap from somewhere
that's quite odd, I don't think it should be doing that
it did it again, i moved .config, but it still knows
hmm, I'm just wondering if it's the default config and looks like the ubuntu one
not a chance, i have some pretty specific stuff set up in the graphics support section for a matrox card
that's really odd. There is a feature in new kernels to expose the running config in /proc/config.gz or something like that, but I don't think the vanilla kernel source is supposed to look for it
you could dig around in arch/i386/ and find a more default config
